scenarioDescription:
The eps Eri Exoplanetary System


Overview

eps Eri is a star with 0.78 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 10.45 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

eps Eri is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the eps Eri system


eps Eri b

eps Eri b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2000-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.39 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of eps Eri b is 248.040 times the mass of Earth. The radius of eps Eri b is 14.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, eps Eri b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system eps Eri, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: eps Eri - System With 1 Exoplanet
